data.title: Repatriation
data.meta_description: Practical information and advice, including but not limited to the documentation you need to apply for RA citizenship and residency, move your belongings, register your address, obtain a social security number, enroll in a school, open a bank account, rent an apartment, and much more.
data.text:
About the Repatriation and Integration Center

The Repatriation and Integration Center serves as a comprehensive resource center to aid repatriates with every aspect of moving to Armenia. The Center was established by the Republic of Armenia Office of the High Commissioner for Diaspora Affairs in partnership with the H. Hovnanian Family Foundation.

The Repatriation and Integration Center aims to promote repatriation, ease the process of repatriation, and ensure a smooth integration process for Diaspora Armenians moving to the homeland.

Our Services

Each repatriate who is thinking about or is in the process of moving to Armenia is assigned an Integration Support Specialist who serves as their primary point of contact throughout the entire process and provides consultation and practical guidance in the following areas:

citizenship and residency permits

moving personal belongings

healthcare

education and culture

social services

employment and work permits

military conscription

customs, taxes, and fees

establishing or moving business equipment

The Center also provides

free-of-charge Armenian language classes

free-of-charge integration seminars

Partners

To ensure the full integration of repatriates into Armenian society, the Repatriation and Integration Center works closely with our partners at Repat Armenia to help repatriates find employment, as well as regularly organizes virtual and in-person forums, networking events, and job fairs.

Repatriation Guide

Click here to download a comprehensive guide on repatriation our Office has prepared with our partners at Repat Armenia Foundation. The guide is available in Eastern Armenian, Western Armenian, Russian, English, Spanish and French.
